title: High Multilateral Debt Service
description: In 2023, Afghanistan's multilateral debt service accounted for 100% of its public and publicly guaranteed debt service, indicating a significant financial burden.

title: High Goods and Services Expense
description: In 2017, 54.78% of Afghanistan's expenses were allocated to goods and services, reflecting a substantial portion of the national budget.

title: High Rate of Violence Against Women
description: In 2015, 46.1% of ever-partnered women aged 15-49 in Afghanistan reported experiencing physical and/or sexual violence in the past year.

title: Cultural Acceptance of Domestic Violence
description: In 2015, 80.2% of Afghan women believed a husband is justified in beating his wife for any of five reasons, highlighting deep-rooted cultural issues.

title: High Female Mortality Due to Pollution
description: In 2019, the mortality rate attributed to household and ambient air pollution for Afghan females was 265 per 100,000, indicating severe environmental health risks.

title: Significant Health Expenditure Impact on Poverty
description: In 2020, 6.5% of Afghanistan's population was pushed below the 60% median consumption poverty line due to out-of-pocket health expenditures.

title: High Current Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, Afghanistan's current health expenditure was 23.09% of GDP, reflecting a significant allocation of resources to health services.

title: High Female Contributing Family Workers
description: In 2023, 66.78% of female employment in Afghanistan was as contributing family workers, indicating limited formal employment opportunities for women.

title: High Female Youth Not in Education or Employment
description: In 2024, 82.60% of Afghan female youth were not in education, employment, or training, highlighting challenges in youth engagement and empowerment.

title: High Merchandise Imports from MENA
description: In 2023, 23.68% of Afghanistan's merchandise imports came from low- and middle-income economies in the Middle East & North Africa, indicating regional trade reliance.

title: Lowest Water Productivity
description: In 2021, Afghanistan had a water productivity of 0.81 constant 2015 US$ GDP per cubic meter of total freshwater withdrawal, indicating inefficiency in water use.

title: Minimal Domestic Credit to Private Sector
description: In 2020, domestic credit to the private sector by banks was only 2.99% of GDP, reflecting limited financial support for private enterprises.

title: Negative Net Domestic Credit
description: Afghanistan's net domestic credit was -79.38 billion LCU in 2020, indicating a contraction in domestic lending.

title: Deflationary Economy
description: In 2024, Afghanistan experienced a deflation rate of -6.60%, suggesting a decrease in consumer prices.

title: Low Government Budget Utilization
description: Primary government expenditures were only 48.67% of the original approved budget in 2021, indicating underutilization of allocated funds.

title: Weak Economic Management
description: The CPIA economic management cluster rating was 1.17 in 2023, reflecting poor economic governance.

title: Poor Fiscal Policy
description: Afghanistan's CPIA fiscal policy rating was 1 in 2023, indicating ineffective fiscal management.

title: Gender Inequality in Education
description: The gender parity index for youth literacy was 0.54 in 2022, highlighting significant gender disparities in education.

title: Low Female Employment in Management
description: In 2020, only 5.89% of senior and middle management positions were held by females, indicating gender disparity in leadership roles.

title: Minimal Health Expenditure
description: Domestic general government health expenditure per capita was only $0.63 in 2022, reflecting limited investment in public health.

title: Low Antiretroviral Therapy Coverage
description: In 2022, only 9% of people living with HIV had access to antiretroviral therapy, indicating inadequate healthcare provision.

title: Limited Infrastructure for Trade and Transport
description: The logistics performance index for infrastructure quality was 1.7 in 2022, suggesting poor trade and transport facilities.

title: Low Female Labor Force Participation
description: In 2024, the ratio of female to male labor force participation was 7.30%, highlighting significant gender disparities in employment.
